controller

Class MainScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MainScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class MainScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for mainScreen.fxml. This class interacts with multiple logic classes and controllers for other views.

      • timeline

        private javafx.animation.Timeline timeline
        Timeline allows evolution of the board and animation at a set time interval. This object is manipulated to start and pause animation and to change its rate.

      • returnToMenuEvent

        public void returnToMenuEvent()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Set menu.fxml as the scene of primaryStage. This allows the user to go back and choose a different board type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fxml can not be loaded

      • draw

        private void draw()
        Call the draw function in the Board class.

      • calculateCanvasWidth

        private double calculateCanvasWidth(int boardWidth)
        A function used to calculate the appropriate canvas size in case the dimensions of the board changes. Used to avoid empty spaces on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        boardWidth - number of columns in the current game board
        Returns:
        the canvas width that fits the size of the current board and cells

      • playEvent

        public void playEvent()
        An event listener that gets called upon pressing start. Starts the animation if it isn't running, pauses otherwise.

      • play

        private void play()
        Start timeline.

      • pause

        private void pause()
        Stop timeline.

      • resetEvent

        public void resetEvent()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Set the board back to a previous state. If a file is loaded the board data in fileData will be alllied. If no file is loaded a fresh board is set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fileData can not be applied

      • openGifCreatorEvent

        public void openGifCreatorEvent()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a stage and displays the GIF creator interface. Pauses the game if it is running.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fxml fails to load

      • setCellSizeEvent

        public void setCellSizeEvent()
        Calculates a cell size and snaps it and the slider to the nearest possible value that would fit in the canvas perfectly based on the horizontal size.

      • setAliveCellColorEvent

        public void setAliveCellColorEvent()
        Sets GoL.AliveCellColor when a color is picked in aliveCellColorPicker.

      • setDeadCellColorEvent

        public void setDeadCellColorEvent()
        Sets GoL.DeadCellColor when a color is picked in deadCellColorPicker.

      • decreaseSpeedEvent

        public void decreaseSpeedEvent()
        Decreases the rate of the timeline. If the game is paused this method only updates the fpsLabel and the currRate variable in GoL and lets the new rate take effect when the game is resumed.

      • increaseSpeedEvent

        public void increaseSpeedEvent()
        Increases the rate of the timeline. If the game is paused this method only updates the fpsLabel and the currRate variable in GoL and lets the new rate take effect when the game is resumed.

      • cellClickEvent

        public void cellClickEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Kills or gives birth to a cell when clicked.
        Parameters:
        event - the event created upon clicking the canvas

      • boardDragEvent

        public void boardDragEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Functionally the same as cellClickEvent, only with the possibility of dragging across multiple cells to kill/give birth to cells quickly.
        Parameters:
        event - the event created upon click and drag on the canvas

      • openRulesEditor

        public void openRulesEditor()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a stage and displays the rulesEditor interface. Pauses the game if it is running.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openSetDimensionsWindow

        public void openSetDimensionsWindow()
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates an instance of DimensionInputDialog to let the user set the board to a preferred size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if dialog is interrupted

      • readFileFromDisk

        public void readFileFromDisk()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads and applies data from a local Run-Length Encoding file. The file is located with a FileChooser, read with a FileReader, broken up into separate strings of data, which are then parsed and applied. Finally feedback is given to the user of how successful the operation went.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if .rle file can not be read

      • readFileFromURL

        public void readFileFromURL()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads and applies Run-Length Encoding data from a URL. The URL input from an input dialog, read with an InputStreamReader, broken up into separate strings of data, which are then parsed and applied. Finally feedback is given to the user of how successful the operation went.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input stream can not be read

      • openFileEditorWindow

        public void openFileEditorWindow()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • applyFileData

        void applyFileData(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fileData)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Applies the data in fileData to the game. Such as title, origin, comments, board dimensions, rules, and the pattern on the board.
        Parameters:
        fileData - hashmap containing strings of data derived from .rle input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fileData can not be read

      • confirmFileData

        private void confirmFileData(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fileData)
        Checks which parts of the Run-Length Encoding file har been implmented and gives feedback to the user in the form of a dialog.
        Parameters:
        fileData - hashmap containing strings of data derived from .rle input

      • displayRules

        private void displayRules()
        Builds a String representing the currently applied rules and displays it in a label.

        private void calculateCellSize()
        Re-evaluates an appropriate cellsize if a new board pattern is loaded.

      • displayDimensions

        private void displayDimensions()
        Displays the current board dimensions in a label.
